original_title: China EV maker BYD ties up with JKH of Sri Lanka
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – China’s BYD said it has tied up with Sri Lanka’s John Keells Holdings to provide zero-emission vehicles to Sri Lanka.
BYD makes cars, buses, trucks, battery storage and electric charging systems. BYD, which also produces hybrids has overtaken Tesla in 2023.
“We’re striving to align diverse lifestyles with eco-conscious mobility choices globally,” Liu Xueliang, General Manager of BYD Asia-Pacific Auto Sales Division said in a statement.

“This collaboration enables us to offer a range of advanced, eco-friendly passenger vehicles in Sri Lanka, furthering our mission to integrate eco-conscious with diverse lifestyles, and making ‘electric vehicle’ the ‘essential vehicle’ in people’s daily lives.”
JKH was moving into new energy vehicles (NEV) as part of the group’s commitment to sustainability.

“Through this partnership, we will bring advanced NEV models to Sri Lanka, letting our people experience the world’s leading technologies of NEV and contribute to an eco-friendly and sustainable Sri Lanka,” JKH Chairman Krishan Balendra said.
In 2022, BYD said it sold 1.86 million new energy vehicles in 70 countries. (Colombo/Nov22/2023)
